ously (provide cricoid pressure if the skills are available).
o Suxamethonium 100 mg intravenously can be given by practitioners confident of intubation (usual dose
is 1-1.5mg/kg).
o The trachea should be intubated.
o Capnography and agent analysis should be utilised (confirm position of the tube by capnograph trace,
and 
auscultation of both axillae and over the stomach.)
o Ventilation
 should be provided at 12 breaths per minute and 400 mL tidal volume.
